website_summaries.verdict: Most cats love chasing a laser dot. The Bolt lets you set an automatic play session or manually work the toy for bonding time with your cat.
pros: In automatic mode, the battery-powered toy flashes random laser patterns to keep cat active
Automatically shuts off after 15 minutes so Kitty won't be overstimulated
cons: Some owners complain the laser moves too quickly in automatic mode

customer_reviews.title: Was so happy to find this
customer_reviews.text: Was so happy to find this! My cats LOVE my laser pointer but I just don't have time to stand around doing it all day. This was the perfect solution. I noticed other reviewers complaining about it going up on the ceiling. Which is perfect for any lazy cat who just wants to lay back and watch the laser in action. However, I decided to wedge it in between some books so I could angle it and now it only goes on the floor and they are able to chase it. Now I just wish there was a setting option for longer than 15 min!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Bella

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one day
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one day. Laser just stopped working. It moves around as intended. Just not illuminated. That being said, cat loved it for his bday. I was just secretly hoping it would last more than eight hours. Call me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: T.  McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Cat enjoys it, but not noise.
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes it! She was a bit shy at first because she didn't like the noise it made and then finally she warmed up to it. I wish the speed could be a little faster... It does have two height adjustments and on one you would have to have it sitting on the floor or no more than a foot above floor or it well be wall level.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.V

customer_reviews.title: Only for cats that run on walls
customer_reviews.text: This is a laser. It moves in a static patter that seems random, but is definitely pre-programmed. If your cats use their eyes more than their ears AND they will chase anything with abandon, then buy this. However, if your cats are patient hunters, waiting for their moment to strike, this is not for your pets. Also, if your cats use their ears, they will watch the device more than the dot. It moves too fast for patient hunters. My cats get bored after 1 minute. I have MUCH more success using it in manual mode. But, why pay this price when a simple laser pointer is a fraction of the cost?
customer_reviews.author: C. McDannold

customer_reviews.title: Good but the pattern is a little crazy so my cat just stares at it
customer_reviews.text: I decided to keep it after I really thought about it. The product itself is not bad, especially compare to the more expensive ones. But the pattern is kinda weird though, it keeps moving and the pattern is a little crazy or I don’t know if it’s bc my apartment is too small. My cat usually stares at the laser for a few seconds( I’m thinking she’s coming up w a strategy)but it keeps moving like crazy so she just ended up staring at it the whole time and often will lose track of it. I ended up manually playing w her a lot which is why I decided to keep it so at least I have a laser pointer.
customer_reviews.author: tumentugs

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kitty is intrigued with the laser. He is an energetic 15 mo. old. He will run after the beam for a long time (10 - 15 minutes) and we turn it off so that he is not too exhausted. So I would say after the first 3 sessions that we have gotten our moneys worth. It concerns me that the cat is curious and brought his face right up to the machine that is the source of the laser, so then we must stop it or move it. Trying to direct the beam to the floor from a high perch. There is a warning (not obvious on box) that it should not be directed into eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Esther Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Good Exercise For Indoor Cat But Radiation Exposure (not in product description)
customer_reviews.text: Loves it! This thing keeps my cat on her toes! Tries to catch the red dot and helps with her exercise since she an in-door cat. The weird noise it makes is pretty loud for nighttime play unless I put it in a different room so it doesn’t keep me awake. But the mention of exposure to radiation that was mentioned with the information that came with it (??) I don’t recall reading that in the description before I purchased it. I would return it but my kitty loves it, so I won’t use it as much as she likes.
customer_reviews.author: CatBaybee

customer_reviews.title: not worth it unless you’re in a dark room
customer_reviews.text: cat isn’t interested in it at all cause the laser is not big or bright enough to catch her attention. my sister had one years ago & her dogs loved it! must have an older version. VERY disappointed even though reviews on here were mixed.... tried showing the difference of brightness vs a hand-held cheap laser you get from hardware store, $1store, walmart etc... suggest a pure no lit room that shows the best laser light for the Bolt otherwise it’s hard to see the laser depending on the light source you put the Bolt nearby. pros: delivered on time & it works (with 4 AA batteries - Not included)
customer_reviews.author: Lunasm000ke

customer_reviews.title: Battery hog
customer_reviews.text: My dog is absolutely addicted to this toy. If she can see it, she whines for it. It can entertain her for hours. This would be a perfect five with a couple of enhanced features. First, it would be very helpful to have a plug and adapter so that it could run on wall power, because it chews up batteries. Second, I would love to be able to choose how long it stays on for, instead of having to turn it back on every 15 minutes. Finally, it would be nice to be able to switch it off rather than either wait for the 15 minutes to end or remove the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Home Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: She said her cats hated the noise and also couldn't follow the light well ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this product and it was not what I was expecting. The laser toy is quite loud and not exactly cat friendly. I tried using this on a coffee table, the floor, and top of my hutch. The laser goes all over the place to the point where my cat couldn't even follow it. Plus, its fast. It goes swirling around the room vs staying in a spot to "tease" a cat and allow it to play. My coworker also bought it and is going to return hers. She said her cats hated the noise and also couldn't follow the light well enough. I say stick with the traditional laser pointer.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney E

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS ! Much better than the others I bought
customer_reviews.text: This item is great ! I purchased this one after having purchased a smaller flat model from the same company through Amazon. That one didn't excite my cat and was not variable with the laser pattern. This one is random and my kitten loves it !! Much better design.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping it would save me time in constantly playing with the laser with my cats, but it doesn’t. The auto setting is too fast and random. It goes all over the place very quickly and the cats just don’t care to follow it. They just don’t like it. It’s fine if I’m doing it myself on the manual setting, but it’s not worth it to me. I’d rather have the smaller laser pointer that is $5 if I have to do it myself for them.
customer_reviews.author: Losin' It

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this is one of the first toys my cat has been genuinely interested in. My cat is insane. Meaning she’s got a lot of energy and a demanding attitude. This toy is legit a lifesaver. Just turn it on and for like ten minutes she’s completely distracted and I get a moment without her screaming at me. Our dog likes it too, only problem is the dog has learned the sound of the button pressing so now I have to put the cat in a separate room in order to play untrampled.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Yeskie

customer_reviews.title: Worked sort of, for a while
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats goes crazy for laser lights, so I thought she might like this. I found out the laser works best in a bigger room, which is neither here nor there really. I was disappointed at how weak the laser seemed - my cat couldn't see it at all during the day, even with some rather dark curtains drawn. After my cat knocks the toy off a rather short table twice, the device stopped working all together. This might work well for some cats, but not really for curious ones. And you'd better have a larger room that's very dim if you want your cats to actually play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Toy for a 45lb Dog
customer_reviews.text: Our 45lb dog loves to chase this beam of light for hours when she can’t get outside due to the weather. In fact, she tries to turn it on herself to play with it, and has knocked each one over several times before she managed to break them on our stone tile floor. If not for that, they would have lasted a long time. We are on number three! The only complaint is that it takes 4AA batteries which only seem to last a couple of days in our house. But again, I say the dog will use it for hours at a time on days we can’t get out and walk due to the weather!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen L ODell

customer_reviews.title: Too Fast and Too High
customer_reviews.text: This device has potential, minus the laser radiation issue, but only if the speed can be SLOWED WAY DOWN, and make it so it doesn't dance ON THE CEILING. Our cats can jump, but not that high, and by the time they find the laser it's GONE. They lose interest super fast because of those issues. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Charlotte Approved !
customer_reviews.text: I buy Charlotte all the nice toys but she doesn’t want them. BUT she loves lasers. Got this on Amazon and it sits next to me while I’m working from home and she’s loving it. Best part is that it turns off after 15 minutes. ONLY DOWNSIDE is that it is a little noisy (machine noises) and distracts me.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria | For What It's Werth Blog

customer_reviews.title: Good, but batteries run out fast
customer_reviews.text: Great automatic laser for kitties or doggies. My baby kitty is obsessed with her laser toys. We had to get an automated toy as she wouldn't stop crying for her red rubies. My only disappointment is that the batteries run out quickly as she wants it on all the time. We now look for the ones that have a rechargeable USB port instead of batteries & those are more sustainable.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Laser reaches limited areas
customer_reviews.text: My cats are both 2 years old. They like this to a degree, for example when I take it out and open it and the laser starts going off, they’ll get excited. But the laser doesn’t travel as freely as a handheld laser would. It goes to limited places in the room. Thus, my cats lose interest because it’s not playing too actively with them such as making them run around the room or trying to climb the wall and furniture. Also, my cats were able to discover where the light was coming from and they lose interest from that as well. I do recommend this for perhaps kittens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it/uses a lot of batteries/arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this thing and it's a life saver for me because it gives me an alternative for my little one to play and chase something when she's hyper but I'm too busy to play with her. Usually I pull a string for her to chase and it's her favorite thing in the world lol, but she does enjoy this too thankfully. It does require 4 AA batteries and eats through them kinda quick, but it's worth the price in my opinion, as long your cat enjoys laser pointers and such. Arrived on time too.
customer_reviews.author: Anime1389

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 4 cats love it
customer_reviews.text: We have four cats. Three are avid fans of this toy, though they still prefer when I use the hand-held pointer. I will use that to get them engaged, then let this toy take over, by and large. Reasonably good battery life, but keep fresh spares handy. The brighter the dot, the more interested the cats are. For cat #4, I have a small r/c truck. I put treats, in the flatbed.
customer_reviews.author: Fonebone

customer_reviews.title: Instant hit!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy. She will even sit and stare at me balefully until I come over and turn it on, so she can play with it. She loved it from the moment I first turned it on, so I didn't have to worry about introducing it or getting her used to it. This works out really well for me also, since my cat likes to watch her prey for long periods before attacking. I usually get bored long before she does! So this is perfect, because it never gets bored. I recommend this for any cat with a red dot fixation, a need to exercise, and/or a need to be kept occupied.
customer_reviews.author: Jayhuskette

customer_reviews.title: Average, but fun laser
customer_reviews.text: A laser pointer that moves and turns off all on its own? It's really a great idea. The product works super well. The laser moves at a decent speed and pauses for the cat to catch it. Plus, the laser goes out a long distance from the actual device itself. Personally, my cat enjoys it for a little while at night, but gets bored because it repeats the same pattern. Also, he can't see it very well in the light, so he only plays with it when it is dark. If your cat is obsessed with lasers though, they might enjoy it more. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Guillo

customer_reviews.title: Why is the laser dying?!
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this laser toy is fantastic. The motor isn't crazy loud (you can hear it, yes; but it would only bother someone who likes things very quiet), the speed and variety of the movement seems to be great for Louie (we point it down the hall against the wall, against the back of the couch, etc; just down on the floor might get boring, who knows). The problem is that, after a month or so, the laser has become faded and blinky rather than bright. It's not a battery issue, it's just that the mechanism to create the laser is failing. Too bad, Louie would use this for years if it held up.
customer_reviews.author: David Massie

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product, it works well. I have weird cat and she was not amazed with this toy, I was more excited than she was. I chased the beam for a while to inspire her but then I gave up. The product is fine so I did not return it, my cat just sits and looks at the laser beam moving for as long as the toy is working (there is a built in timer and it will turn off after a while). But if your cat likes chasing the regular laser beams she/he will enjoy this toy a lot.
customer_reviews.author: ArtM

customer_reviews.title: Best $18 i ever spent
customer_reviews.text: absolutely loved getting this item for my energy filled fur baby, however i was sad that it didn't come with batteries. The timer in the laser is only for 15 minutes and I wish it lasted longer, but the light is very bright and my kitty gets so excited when we turn it on. Good buy for any pet that loves laser time!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Knecht

customer_reviews.title: About what I expected. Not a bad toy, but a little noisy and my cat personally didn't take to it.
customer_reviews.text: Buying toys for pets is always a risk, especially cats; such fickle creatures. My cat loves the laser pointer so I hoped that this would entertain her and give me a break, but she barely even acknowledges it. The motor isn't exactly loud, but it's far from silent. Especially with the constant starting and stopping at irregular intervals it's hard to tune out. My roommate's cat seems to like it at least so it's not completely wasted at my house. I've also noticed that when pointed down as low to the floor as possible, the casing actually blocks the laser for close to 25% of the arc.
customer_reviews.author: JoshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Change is laser light
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved this toy when I first bought it. Then one day it stopped working. I tried multiple sets of batteries and nothing. So I ordered a new one. The new one is completely different as other sellers have stated, particularly the laser. It is NOT EVEN CLOSE to the brightness and thickness of the laser dot as before. I've now had this second one for only 2 months. I'm stating to look for different alternatives. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Martini

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my TV stand facing as far down as possible so the laser stays around the roughly 5x7 rug between the couch and TV. It's only marginally sturdy - my cat figured out where the laser was coming from and knocked it off the TV stand a few times and now it rotates but there's no laser. She loved it while it worked, though, so I still think this was worth the price! Only small complaint is that it makes a clicking noise as it rotates through each cycle and it can be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying this (our first finally broke after 2 years of consistent use), and kitty still loves it. Best toy to give him a bit of fun and exercise. Doesn't require too large an area, and batteries last for quite a while, dependent upon use of course. Highly recommend. Packaging did come kind of squished but I am guessing that is more of an Amazon thing than the actual seller's fault, so my rating is for the product itself!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it is very easy to see and other times it will fade and ...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as my cat hears me cut on the laser she comes running and is occupied for the entire 15 minutes that it is programmed to be on. The automatic turn off is a plus, especially if you are wanting your cat to have some more play time but do not have time to play yourself. The only negative comment I have is that I have noticed that the laser point differs in size. Sometimes it is very easy to see and other times it will fade and is very hard to see even in the dark. When this happens my cat is just laying there and is not actually being active because she cant find the laser point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats will run for this laser, E V E R Y W H E R E
customer_reviews.text: My furry children love this laser, we have had many laser toys in the past, but none are like this, it has a particular patter it follows that is crazy, and it keeps them entertained for long periods of time. I love the exercise they are getting chasing it, it mimics people movements and you can elevate it for some real running around. Thank you to whoever made this thing, its amazing, a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Genovese

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: But it is still a good laser toy for your cats. If they get too close, they can knock it over, so I put it on a box or table. The only problem then is the laser can end up shining on the wall. Watching a cat try to jump a wall is funny, but not if their claws scratch the paint. Would I buy this again? Yes, depending on the price.
customer_reviews.author: jammer2099

customer_reviews.title: If only the dog would go away
customer_reviews.text: The dog might love this more than the cat. You have to make sure kids don't grab it and shine it into eyes. We had an earlier model of this that I liked better. The mirror easily clicked into three positions. This one has a rough transition to the different positions.
customer_reviews.author: Becky duPuis Bartek

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent and our cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: We had one for years until someone dropped in the batteries the wrong way. They absolutely can NOT survive the replacement of batteries in the wrong direction. The circuit was toast immediately. We got a replacement and have no plans of letting anyone who doesn't read and follow directions to change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dan King

customer_reviews.title: Great for border collie puppy
customer_reviews.text: Without a project assigned to them, adolescent Border Collies will destroy everything you own. This amazing tool keeps him busy for the full 15 minutes. As soon as he sees me take it out of the cabinet, he RUNS to the area where I usually set it up. The sound is not a problem. Neither is the oval laser path. I was also concerned he would knock it over or laser himself in the eye, but the beam lands far enough away from the unit that neither of these have been a problem. If you have a dog who likes to chase moving objects whom you would like to keep busy, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: m_flamingo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, cat loves the random patterns, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve only been playing with this thing for less than an hour, and I can tell you the following: 1. Our cat loves it. It’s a great random program, and she doesn’t lose interest at all. 2. It’s got surprisingly good build quality/design for a sub-$20 motorized toy. Buy one. The cat will love you for it. (If cats are truly capable of love, that is)
customer_reviews.author: Z. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Smart cats figure it out and lose interest.
customer_reviews.text: The laser works great, but it is fast and you have to find just the right angle so that it doesn’t project in the wrong places. The biggest problem was that my cat figured out where the elusive red dot comes from and now she just sits in front of the device staring at it. Was ok while she was still interested.
customer_reviews.author: Supermom101

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly, doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.text: The laser wasn't very effective as a toy, both my cats were interested at first, but the light was too intermittent. It's very loud and the working range was limited despite some adjustability. But the main problem is that it broke within a week. I took it apart thinking I could repair it, but the mechanism is cheap and not repairable. The contacts are just not meant to last, and it relies on a soldered wire to hold with constant movement. It's just a poor design overall.
customer_reviews.author: K. Prom

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: After the 4th time using, the lazer was to weak to show up and then just stopped working. New batteries were placed in item and then replaced to see if that was the problem. Nope it's just junk. I just threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: flo

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but needs some design revision
customer_reviews.text: There's a severe design flaw. First, to explain how this thing is constructed - there is a moving laser pointing upwards in the body of the device. There is a diagonal mirror in the head, and this reflects the laser beam outward at an adjustable vertical angle. The problem is that the housing of the mirror interferes with the laser beam. So at almost all mirror orientations, the laser beam is trapped within the head for about 40% of the time. Kitty is interested at first, but gets bored and walks away when the light is not visible. This product is a good concept, but needs some refining.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Cat

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Can't be too made because this was very cheap compared to what you'd find in a pet store. Cats loved it and I would turn it on multiple times a day because it shuts off on its own. However, I've only had it since October and the red laser is fading. Tried changing the batteries but the light is still not like it was when I first bought it. Now my cats barely notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my youngest cat and he absolutely loves it. Just press the button and it runs for about 15 minutes and then it will automatically shut off. He burns off some energy and I don't have to sit there and hold a handheld laser for 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff 121

customer_reviews.title: CAT LIKES
customer_reviews.text: Our cat really likes this laser! We put it on for her twice a day. She is a cat though and stared to just stand and watch it instead of go crazy and chase it lol! She's 4. We were trying to get her to get some exercise. The only one negative thing about this toy is it takes 4 double A batteries and they need to be replaced often. We got a large pack from Costco and have almost gone through it pretty quick - but, we love our Cat so she gets what she wants ha!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Laser Light for my cats/cat lol
customer_reviews.text: I liked that I didn’t have to be holding the light anymore. I wanted it to be easy and fun since they did like chasing the laser light but only one of my cats finds it fun the other really doesn’t care. I love that it has a timer and turns off. I’m glad one cats plays with it so worth it to me. I do wish it did more light on the floor rather than the walls and or doors. I don’t want my cats/cat trying to climb the walls or doors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's not just for cats. We have a Special Papillon that loves it.
customer_reviews.text: It's not just for cats. We have a "Special Papillon" who should have been a cat that is just CrAzY about this light. This is the second one we have bought because the batteries went dead in the first one and he climbed up on the table when we left room and knocked it off and basically destroyed it getting it apart to see why it wouldn't shine the light anymore. He's since gotten older and now he chases it for a few minutes and then lays down and watches it until it turns off. He then usually takes a nap and chases it in his dreams.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Norton

customer_reviews.title: light goes out before batteries
customer_reviews.text: i bought this and the red laser light bulb went out in the first week.. Returned for a replacement and 3 weeks later the second unit laser light bulb was not working. Batteries did not need changing as it moved but without the light bulb it is useless
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my active cat
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I don't love it but my cat does. This is the only toy I've bought that captures his interest. I had trouble getting it aimed correctly but then realized it has to be on the floor to shine on areas the cat can get to. It's nicely adjustable, shuts itself off after about 15 minutes. And my cat is high-maintenance, worse than a husband! Wants to talk to me as soon as I get home from work. So I turn on the Laser Cat Toy and get 15 minutes of quiet so I can unwind.
customer_reviews.author: Envy224

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but really good!
customer_reviews.text: They have yet to create a perfect cat laser, this one is really good tho! I'm still searching for a cat laser that really operates in a way that cat's like. moving side to side and some random movements is ok, but cat's get bored after a few minutes. It's a decent brand
customer_reviews.author: jeff beaver

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy, but i was under the impression that it darted around in all different directions. It switches between going clockwise and counterclockwise in a circle. Its a lazer reflecting off a mirror, which is adjustable, so you can have it pointed more forward, or more downward. Overall, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Bridge

customer_reviews.title: Amusing for a kitten but human interaction still highly pre-furred.
customer_reviews.text: My high energy kitten is amused by it but really prefers human interaction. My more sedentary cats ignore lasers. I set the Frolicat BOLT on a short step stool and adjust it to go up the wall. Kitten especially likes that movement, but is smart enough to anticipate the pre-programmed repetitive stuff and often ignores it. However, when I bring out the hand held laser she goes nuts. The FroliCat BOLT Interactive Laser Pet Toy is useful to have around as an additional toy. I appreciate that it uses commonly found long lasting AA batteries. However, your cats really like playing with you. Keep a hand held device on hand also.
customer_reviews.author: Max Grodty

customer_reviews.title: This thing burns through batteries like crazy. It takes 4 double A batteries and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have seven cats and one of them in particular is an absolute crackhead for this toy. I would give it 5 stars but I have one major complaint. This thing burns through batteries like crazy. It takes 4 double A batteries and I have to replace them every 2 weeks on average. I wish this company would make this product with an actual plug to plug it into a wall. Also, this toy only seems to last 6 to 12 months before the motor burns out. But, since my one cat absolutely loves this toy, I keep replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Fredenburg

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design
customer_reviews.text: Moves in a quick and useless pattern that none of my cats cared about and runs all the way too far up the wall for them to reach, even when placed on a high point like the top of the cat tree (which would likely just get knocked down and broken anyway)
customer_reviews.author: Celcuddy4817

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this one star because it came broken. The laser did not work. I could hear the mechanism moving, but the light never came out. I even bought some excellent batteries so I knew it could last a long time. Never got to use it because it did. Not. Work. I wouldn’t waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: 1 month old and already broken!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for entertaining an overactive kitty, however the laser itself was a bit spotty (light would sometimes not come on) and now laser light does not turn on at all, though turning mechanism still works. Only used 5-8 times, not damaged etc. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Mulreany

customer_reviews.title: My cats liked this toy at first
customer_reviews.text: My cats liked this toy at first, but have since gotten very bored of it. The repetitive circular motion does little to stimulate them. They end up sitting lazily right in the laser path, the light beam shining right on them, after just a few seconds of chasing when I turn the device on. In the meantime, the loud whirring noise drives me nuts. On the other hand, if I pause the pattern and wave the contraption around on its solid laser beam setting, my kitties go crazy chasing the light. It goes to show that they don't get tired of playing, but rather they are bored of the round-and-round pattern which is too fast and too repetitive.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Scissor Claw

customer_reviews.title: Cat and cat lady approved!
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research on different automatic laser pointers, I’m really glad I chose this one! It’s much quieter than a previous one I had, and the laser has a much better flow that keeps my cats engaged. I was a little worried that it only had one laser, as I have multiple cats, but the laser spans a large area, so my cats can share! I also like how it turns off on its own after about 15 minutes. My cats love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: If you want a little time to yourself, this is a great way to occupy the cat.
customer_reviews.text: So my dad used to have to keep the cat busy while he was trying to also feed the bird and set up his morning crap (the bird's crap that is). Now dad just has to set this on the floor and the cat is occupied no problem. I figured it wasn't really going to do much for her since the jerking motions were maybe too random... nope, she loves it, keeps coming back for more, and just sits there staring at it when the thing shuts down. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: CBar

customer_reviews.title: Kitten and Not Observant Cat Toy
customer_reviews.text: I love the promise of not wearing out my wrist playing with the laser pointer. Problem for me is my cat is smart enough to hunt the laser toy instead of the laser and once he knocks it down it can't function well due to only shining the laser on one side. This would be great for a kitten (mine is full grown) and a cat who doesn't try to determine where the laser comes from.
customer_reviews.author: H.L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Laser Cats!?
customer_reviews.text: Laser's movement pattern is 'alright', can become predictable. I usually follow up a session of this with a toy my frustrated cat can actually 'get her paws on' so as to allow for the satisfaction that comes from actually capturing prey Lasers are great toys most cats readily chase tenaciously but must be mixed with other play toys so they don't go 'bonkers' from chasing the mysterious dot. I'm satisfied with the cost given how much my cat enjoys the product; a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybrew

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and durable toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for our sweet cat who is 14 years old. She loves the toy! She spends hours chasing the red dot. We turn it on for her when we leave for work and school and sometimes at night. It really makes us happy to have found a toy that she engages into and doesn’t get bored with.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Brown

customer_reviews.title: Don't waster your money
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved this toy and they would bug me to turn it on for them. I bought my first one and it lasted a about 9 months or so and just stopped working. New batteries added, nothing. So, I had to buy a new one, not a big deal it was not that expensive and I buy anything for my spoiled cats. Not even 2 months later and the same thing happens. It just stops working. The concept of this toy is very nice however, they need to figure out why it just stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Louisa Fledderman

customer_reviews.title: Really Wanted to like this!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought this for my cats and when I put the batteries in, it was fine, but after about 5 minutes, the laser began to dim to the point where you can barely see it. The mirror was very loose and couldn't be positioned in steady position, had to use tape to hold it in place. Sad that after putting fresh new batteries in, the laser only lasts for about 5-10 minutes before it becomes too dim to even see.
customer_reviews.author: James Davis

customer_reviews.title: It is ok, but not like the picture suggests
customer_reviews.text: It moves the internal mirror in an oval pattern.. and it goes back and forth and stops sometimes and starts again. My cats love it, but don't think that this will zig-zag or go in crazy directions, it only goes back and forth in an oval shape.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and fun for doggos too!
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase. First one is still alive after two years of many dropping to the floor and motion broken =Light still comes on so it still works! Just needed the motion as my youngest pup is obsessed with this toy and actually helps her get extra exercise chasing the light. With the (15min-ish) timer already built in, all you need is turn it on and make a happy pet. If you hold onto the switch button for few seconds, light motion will stop to stabilize. For the price and durability, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nozomi Brown

customer_reviews.title: Eh, works just fine
customer_reviews.text: Works alright, it mostly spins the dot in circles but changes the radius of the circle and moves the circle around. And it stops a few times and leaaves the dot in the same spot two or three times in a cycle. After you hit the button it goes on in a preset pattern over about 15 min. It's a bit of a basic design but it works just fine. I found it works best on a ledge like a counter or mantle.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Moves fast, a little hard to see, dies quickly, but my dog still seems to love it. Lol
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves lasers so I thought this would be great. She does love it but it's hard for her to see as the dot seems a little smaller than a regular laser pointer and it moves pretty fast. You can adjust the laser direction up and down but not the speed. It also died fast. I will try rechargeable batteries. I didnt even think about that. She does seem to like it tho just would be perfect if it moved slower or was a little bit bigger of a dot and if it was chargeable.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: a useful distraction when you need to study/work around cats
customer_reviews.text: It does make some noise, about as much as a mans electric shaver. My cats needed to investigate it for that reason. You will need to use the angle adjustment and additionally try to position the whole thing accordingly (I had to put it at a 75 degree angle by placing it in a tissue box). It worked well and 15 minutes is plenty of time. The laser dot is clear and plenty large enough to be visible to kitties. Overall, its worth it even if it only distracts your babies 1/5 of the time.
customer_reviews.author: suri

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, requires manual turn on
customer_reviews.text: The red dot is very small and hard to see during the day. Unit requires manual turn on and only runs 15 minutes. Cats knock it over also. Runs on battery. I dont get the point, if you are going to have to be present anyways why not just get a regular laser pointer. Could be much better...light needs to be bigger, and there should be a timer so it can come on when you are not at home. Would like an electric version.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: You Don’t Have to Hold the Button
customer_reviews.text: My cats think this is the bomb because they love chasing that dot. I agree with them because they prefer me to use it manually and I don’t have to make my arthritic hands cry because you don’t have to hold down the button,
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Leinberger

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the car entertained, not great for small/cluttered spaces
customer_reviews.text: We like this a lot for our cat, it keeps her entertained! The only issue [for our place] is that it’s small and cluttered enough, that sometimes the laser hits furniture and stays there for a bit lol. I recommend for larger spaces, BUT still works pretty well!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Malat

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy and I love the fact that it turns off automatically after so long. Keeps my cats busy and I don't have to try to entertain them for an hour with the hand held laser. I bought one for my parent's cat and he loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: S.K

customer_reviews.title: iffy
customer_reviews.text: product works as described but it seems my cat is very destructive lol. he broke it in less than 2 days ...left it on for a half hour the first day the second he had it knocked over and was batting it around the house it didnt work when I attempted to turn it on again. your cat may not be as destructive or may not go after the toy rather than the light.
customer_reviews.author: R. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Not bad better than some
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this but it is a bit loud not as loud as the larger one but still a bit noisy. I wish the pattern was more random than just a giant circle. I am not sure why these seem to be made so cheaply or why they cannot seem to make a good high quality. I plan on ordering another brand to test out. I am hoping to find one that holds up. My cat has knocked this on the floor or ran into this a few times. It even took a trip down the stairs...
customer_reviews.author: AaronDrTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Our kitties love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our kitties will wear themselves out playing with this item and it doesn't wear us out holding it. We found it's easier to hold it than to sit it on the floor. Otherwise, our kitties knock it over immediately. Well worth the money for several hours of play on the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Riley

customer_reviews.title: Had such high hopes
customer_reviews.text: Just received replacement as previous unit did not work. Small plume of smoke and odour once batteries installed. Motor worked but no laser. Unfortunately the second unit did not work either - totally dead :(
customer_reviews.author: Sunkiss

customer_reviews.title: My cat got bored with this because she can't keep up with it
customer_reviews.text: My cat got bored with this because she can't keep up with it. It doesn't really replicate me playing with her. It moves too fast and is all over the place including up on the walls and then when it stops for a second - it moves again before my cat has a chance to pounce. It's also hard to find a spot in the room where it won't disappear. My daughters cat got bored with it quickly too.
customer_reviews.author: KPETC

customer_reviews.title: Nice laser toy for the laser enthusiast cat
customer_reviews.text: It works, plain and simple. It's a nice toy for my cat to have. She loves laser lights and will play with them for hours, obviously I can't sit around for hours so I found this FroliCat BOLT, the pattern isn't really 'random' but my cat doesn't seem bothered by it, I thought it would make a loud mechanical noise but it's very quiet and doesn't bother her at all. The light is actually brighter than my handheld laser and it's easier for her to find which is good. Overall I feel like it was money well spent, I just got it today and she's already asked me to turn it back on twice!
customer_reviews.author: CaitKat89

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, makes a humming noise
customer_reviews.text: This product certainly does all the good things it says-- however, when I set it out for my kitten, the humming noise from the machine is what kept his attention, not the laser. After about 1 minute of chasing the red laser dot, he noticed the light and sound was coming from this white machine and instead started investigating the machine (and ignoring the laser). So, he certainly likes this toy and I will keep using it, but the noise of it distracts my kitten from play.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product! Our two cats Luke and Leia are so sweet and active so it’s hard sometimes to be able to pay them the full attention they need to keep up with their activity levels 24/7. It’s nice to be able to set this up and they get their full exercise when we aren’t able to. The ability for them to be able to play when we’re unable to is a wonderful option for them. It’s great also knowing that it has a timer so it’ll turn off on its own after a certain amount of time to not drain it’s battery. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned within a few days
customer_reviews.text: I was given this laser toy as a gift and used it every night for a few years. My cats loved it! It can be set to automatic or manual. When set on auto, the laser moves around the room erratically for 10 minutes. It eventually wore out and quit working, so I bought a replacement. After only a few days of use, the moving mirror on the top stuck in place and so the laser no longer moved as intended. I taped it in place and that helped a bit so it's somewhat usable, but this purchase was a disappointment considering the performance and longevity of the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware- stops working after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar toy (different brand but looked the same) that lasted for two years- but this one never really worked very well. With brand new batteries the laser was so faint my cats would ignore it, and after about 5 uses (less than 10 min each use) it stopped entirely. I’m assuming I got a “dud” but my general experience with these laser cat toys is that they don’t work for long, despite the high prices. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: L. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Ok toy to keep your cats entertained for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy because it gives me cats something to do and some exercise when I’m busy or not around and helps them wind down for the day. However, it’s repetitive and doesn’t seem to have much in the way of varying patterns or anything and my oldest cat has lost a bit of interest in it. The light could also be brighter; unless it’s dark it’s hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: K. H.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friend's kitten. She loves chasing the laser. Better yet no one has to hold down the button on the manual laser pen, and we can turn it on to keep kitty occupied while we chat or do whatever.
customer_reviews.author: HeavenlyRain

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been debating one of these for a while! I have 6 active cats and they love to chase lasers. This got them all playing in 10 minutes. Totally worth it! Only thing that would make it better is if it could be rechargable vs using batteries
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: Really fast laser
customer_reviews.text: I love that my cats can be entertained by this for a while without me having to actually sit there with a laser. My main complaint is it's way too fast. It goes from floor to wall to ceiling to across the room in a matter of seconds and it's hard for my cats to keep up.
customer_reviews.author: L. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Is the Motor Supposed to Keep the Cat's Attention?
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my cat's attention longer than most toys, but he's more interested in the loud noise the motor makes than the actual laser. At least it keeps him busy so I can write these reviews without having him climb all over my lap and keyboard. It would be nice if it moved faster in a single direction and pause. That's what my cat used to respond to with a handheld laser. Also quick movements in a small area, as if it were a writhing bug would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fun novelty toy, but our cats grew uninterested
customer_reviews.text: Our cats LOVED this toy for a short time, but don't expect it to replace the handheld laser toys. They were cautious of it due to the noise it makes and their confusion over the fact that the light wasn't being operated by ME. They quickly adapted and played with it for a month - they would often come running when they heard it come on. The downside is that the novelty wore off and after a month, they aren't interested in it.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: pet laser toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good auto laser toy for cats, except you should be able to adjust the range of the laser better; unless you have a very large floor area, it shines up the walls and furniture.
customer_reviews.author: 3inbowie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and keeps the cats entertained
customer_reviews.text: I got 3 cat's ( rescues ) and 2 which are indoor cats are always looking to sneak out when I leave for work. This made it a lot easier now because I turn it on and those 2 kittens come running and get mesmerized by the laser on the floor. even the small dogs get in on it. I love how it auto shuts off after 15 minutes and they're usually exhausted but it'll run a pattern and theres a angle adjuster on the head so you can adjust the beam and cover a larger area
customer_reviews.author: Mods_m4

customer_reviews.title: Too fast but good concept
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Price was ok for what it does. I feel the concept is great but it goes too fast so kitty is engaged at first then realizes its way too fast b/c she can't see where it is next. Then she gives up. If there was a way to speed it down it would be perfect
customer_reviews.author: NAK

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after few weeks
customer_reviews.text: stopped working after few weeks - dont waist your $$
customer_reviews.author: MIRI A.

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: I was really hopeful for this toy because my cat loves chasing laser lights. He liked it at first even though it was difficult to get the angle right so that the light would mostly be on the floor. But, because the light tends to “disappear” (either on the ceiling if you angle it up at all or reflects straight into the toy if the angle is lower) he loses interest. After about a month, he was completely over this toy but still enjoys chasing a handheld light. Also, it seems to drain the battery pretty fast. Your pet may like it but it doesn’t really replace using a handheld pointer.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Our two cats and dog love it. My cats don't play with each other ...
customer_reviews.text: Our two cats and dog love it. My cats don't play with each other so I like that it goes near and far. (by adjusting the mirror) So one cat can play on one side of the room and the other cat sits right next to the laser toy and it will randomly go back and forth. We always play laser games with them but I lose interest before they do. So this toy keeps them entertained! It was funny to watch when we first got it because they all three sat around it amazed. It makes a little bit of noise but that doesn't bother them or me.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchkins

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: It's a great idea!!! I mean my cats love it! But it points more up in the air more than anything so the cats can't follow it enough. They love it when I can keep it closer to where they can jump for the light. It drains batteries like crazy!!! I use it a whole lot also but the batteries don't last long no matter which ones I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Robinson

customer_reviews.title: My three kitty-boys LOVE this laser toy so much
customer_reviews.text: My three kitty-boys LOVE this laser toy so much! It moves, but not too much at once... then stops... gives the cats enough time to pounce, then starts buzzing around again... they LOVE IT! They are at times just as fascinated by the buzzing mirror as by the actual laser. Anyways, it buzzes around for 15-20 minutes then conveniently turns off. I use rechargeable batteries though because it seems to drain them fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nisgore

customer_reviews.title: Light too small
customer_reviews.text: The laser light is very small. My kitty cat prefers the larger light from hand held laser light. Consequently this did not achieve desired result which was to free me from waving laser light for cat's enjoyment. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Light is pretty low
customer_reviews.text: I was supper excited to be getting this for our kitten but once we got it the light was so low, she couldn't see it. We turned off the lights and it still wasn't very good, used new batteries, made no difference. Had my hopes to high for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Happy happy happy laser toy
customer_reviews.text: My two seven pound cats love this. They stalk, they creep, they peer from behind furniture and then suddenly ... leaping through the air to attack the traveling red dot. Again and again. Well, again and again until their best buddy, their 100 pound Saint Bernard, wakes up from his lazy silly nap and joins in, and everyone is chasing the red dot. Best toy ever. I hold it and move it. It's not weighted so it can kerplunk if knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: madeleine gallay

customer_reviews.title: Good toy but doesn't last long...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd or 4th one of these I've purchased, and I came online today to look for another... Love the toy, it is bright and my cats love the pace of it. Love that it shuts off after 10 minutes or so. BUT, each one I purchase is lasting for a shorter and shorter amount of time before it stops working. The one I have right now, that quit working this weekend, I purchased in November! I know things don't last as long as they used to, but I expect something like this to last at least 6 months!
customer_reviews.author: Paula K Hinton

product_meta.title: PetSafe Automatic Laser Cat Toy with Interactive and Random Patterns - Multiple Styles
product_meta.description: Style:BoltThe Bolt is a fun interactive laser toy that can entertain even the laziest cat. The Bolt offers both an automatic mode which generates random patters and a manual mode where you control the action. Turn it on, and watch your cat pounce, chase and bat at the exciting laser patterns.
feature_bullets: SAFE FOR PETS: The Bolt features a Class IIIa laser with a 5mW max power output for a safe play experience; requires 4 AA batteries (sold separately); for best performance, use only alkaline batteries
AUTOMATIC PLAY: The Bolt automatically turns the laser off after 15 minutes to prevent your cat from being over-stimulated and keep the game exciting
ENTERTAINING TO CATS: The exciting laser moves randomly across floors and walls which appeals to the natural hunting instinct of cats; use the mirror adjust button to control where the laser points
QUALITY: The Bolt Interactive Laser Cat Toy is backed by a one year warranty which helps guard against defects in material or workmanship
PRODUCT SUPPORT: PetSafe brand's U.S.-based Customer Care experts will be glad to help; call Monday through Saturday at 1-800-845-3274
EXPERIENCE: PetSafe brand has been an industry leading U.S. manufacturer of pet behavior, containment and lifestyle products since 1991, helping millions of people and pets each year

MORE INFORMATION: To ensure your Bolt stays in good working order, please view the battery diagram to make sure the batteries are installed correctly before using your Bolt Adjustable mirror to aim laser across different surfaces

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
